intro: Centropogon pilosulus var. quindiuensis, commonly known as the Quindío centropogon, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of Colombia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within cloud forests. It features lance-shaped leaves and produces vibrant blue or purple blossoms that attract pollinators. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
